info.title: AWS GW ICE API
info.description:
# Changes
[Click here to view the changes from previous release](http://dfx-swagger.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/?apiKey=iceapi&environment=test&onlineSwaggerUrl=http://localhost:5000%2Fswagger%2Fv1/swagger.json&currentRelease=&apiName=ICE%20API "Show Changes")
# Introduction
Ice API is the main backend endpoint for the ICE Gateway API and will provide all the required data from existing DFX systems. The API uses OAuth2 for all the methods (credentials will be provided separately for each application). Some of the API methods required scope information like the set of dealers Id to execute on or the current DFX user Id to run the query on behalf. These scope values expected to be provide in a request header named "Scope". The Scope header can contain an array or one JSON object with one or more of the following properties:
  - Environment – Should contains one of the values "Prod1", "Prod2", or "Pilot1"
  - DealerId – DFX dealer Id number
  - Vin – Vehicle VIN.
  - CustomerId – DFX customer Id
  - DealerProgramId – DFX unique number for customer, vehicle and dealer.
  - CultureCode – standard culture code (en-US, en-CA, fr-CA, es-MX).
  - DfxUserId – Dealer-FX user Id.
  - IceUserId - Ice user Id.
  - OemName - Name of the OEM.
  - DealerCode - OEMs dealer code
Each method will have information about which Scope information it supports/requires.

# Error handling
In case of internal exception the result response code will be 500 and the response body will contain a Json object will the following properties:
  - Message - the exception message
  - ExceptionTimestamp - an integer timestamp that will help to find that exception in the DFX log system. The application should allow the end user to see this code and direct him to call the support center with that number.
  - Exception - optional - the full exception description and stacktrace. This property will be include only on Dev/Test environments.

parameters.name: appointmentType
parameters.description: Appointment Type for e.g. pitstop, service

parameters.name: FetchWithDMSID
parameters.description: Optional param to fetch DMSIDs for advisors in the dealership

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.description: Provide environment code and dealer Id or OEM name and dealer code

get.description: Returns json data about appointment details.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.description: Provide environment code, dealer Id and culture code or OEM name, dealer code and culture code

put.description:
The following fields within request body are required: Vin, CustomerId, Mileage, and AppointmentDateTimeStr.
            AppointmentDateTimeStr must be over 24 hours from current date. If the frs/drs/repair/recalls (within request body) are null they will be 
            ignored and original values will be kept. To delete a specific type of service, for example drs, set it to an empty list [].

post.summary: Search for customer's media in Media Service API - CRM-1109
post.description:
Search for customer's media by any of the properties in the search model using logical AND between the provided values.
All properties within the request body are optional. {} is a valid body with no properties.
If start/end dates are not provided, the search will include media files from the last 7 days.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.description: Provide array of: environment code and dealer Id, or OEM name and dealer code

post.summary: Upload media service document in Media Service API
post.description:
Upload media service document in Media Service API using customerId and DocumentUrl.
DocumentUrl is mandatory, all other properties within the request body are optional.

get.description:
Returns json data about all vehicle makes.
Scope header is optional, if provided (Environment, dealer Id and culture code) will return only the dealer's
supported makes.
Sale2Service should send the scope information to return only the relevant makes for the current dealer.
Client should keep the order of the return makes array.

supported models.
Sale2Service should send the scope information to return only the relevant makes/models for the current dealer.
Client should keep the order of the return models array.

preferredLanguage.description: Viable values: en-US, en-CA, fr-CA, mx-US

mediaType.description: Media Type Descriptor Metadata, For example: "Delivery PDF" for the delivery checklist PDF

source.description: Source specifies where the files originally come from, for example: "miDelivery"

serviceHistory.description: The attribute IsRequiredScopeHeader is to check if the pdf file requires to pass the scope in the header or not

environment.description: Should contains one of the values "Prod1", "Prod2", or "Pilot1"

isValid.description: Is the account valid. If false should display invalid user message

battery.description: Returns the status of Battery for the Vehicle for e.g. Red, Green, Yellow

brake.description: Returns the status of Brake for the Vehicle for e.g. Red, Green, Yellow

declinedItemCount.description: Returns the total count of declined items.

healthColor.description: Returns the vehicle health status color : for e.g. Red, Green, Yellow

healthScore.description: Returns the vehicle health score for e.g. 80

redCount.description: Returns the total count of Red items safety concerns.

tire.description: Returns the status of Tire for the Vehicle for e.g. Red, Green, Yellow

yellowCount.description: Returns the total count of Yellow items requiring attention.
